paper_title.en: Validation of a food-frequency questionnaire for cohort studies in rural Japan

description.en:
Objectives: To examine the validity and reproducibility of a self-administered food-frequency questionnaire (FFQ) used for two cohort studies in Japan.
Design: Cross-sectional study.
Setting: Two rural towns in the Miyagi Prefecture, in north-eastern Japan.
Subjects: Fifty-five men and 58 women.
Results: A 40-item FFQ was administered twice, I year apart. In the mean time, four 3-day diet records (DRs) were collected in four seasons within the year. We calculated daily consumption of total energy and 15 nutrients, 40 food items and nine food groups from the FFQs and the DRs. We computed Spearman correlation coefficients between the FFQs and the DRs. With adjustment for age, total energy and deattenuation for measurement error with the DRs, the correlation coefficients for nutrient intakes ranged from 0.25 to 0.58 in men and from 0.30 to 0.69 in women, with median of 0.43 and 0.43, respectively. Median (range) of the correlation coefficients was 0.35 (0.30 to 0.72) in men and 0.34 (-0.06 to 0.75) in women for food items and 0.60 (0.10 to 0.76) and 0.51 (0.28-0.70) for food groups, respectively. Median (range) of the correlation coefficients for the two FFQs administered 1 year apart was 0.49 (0.31-0.71) in men and 0.50 (0.40-0.64) in women for nutrients, 0.43 (0.14-0.76) and 0.45 (0.06-0.74) respectively for food items, and 0.50 (0.30-0.70) and 0.57 (0.39-0.66) respectively for food groups. Relatively higher agreement percentages for intakes of nutrients and food groups with high validity were obtained together with lower complete disagreement percentages.
Conclusions: The FFQ has a high reproducibility and a reasonably good validity, and is useful in assessing the usual intakes of nutrients, foods and food groups among a rural Japanese population.

paper_title.en: Dietary sources of nutrient consumption in a rural Japanese population

description.en: We determined the sources of nutrient intake of 59 men and 60 women in two rural towns in the Miyagi Prefecture, a northeastern part of Japan. Four 3-day food records were collected in four seasons within a year. The total dishes and recipes were classified into 197 items. Their percent contributions to the total population consumption of energy and 14 nutrients were calculated as the sum of the nutrient intake contributed by a given dish or recipe divided by the total nutrient intake from all the items. Rice was the largest contributor for energy (29.8%), protein (13.0%) and carbohydrates (45.3%). Miso soup, as a dish, was a leading contributor (7.1%) for fat. The largest contributor for sodium, calcium, carotene, vitamin C were miso soup (17.1%), milk (16.6%), spinach (23.6%), green tea (13.6%), respectively. The result suggests that the examination of nutrient sources based on dishes and recipes, rather than on food materials, may be useful in characterizing the dietary patterns of populations.

paper_title.en: Comparison of urinary bromide levels among people in East Asia, and the effects of dietary intakes of cereal and marine products, (共著)

description.en: We determined the sources of nutrient intake of 59 men and 60 women in two rural towns in the Miyagi Prefecture, a northeastern part of Japan. research_project_title.ja: 環境教育におけるユニバ－サル教材開発-青年海外協力隊員の実践活動をベ-スとした課題の探索とシラバス作成の試み

description.ja: 地球規模で生活と環境の相互関係を捕らえ、理解し、持続ある発展を実現するための教育、とくに、発展途上国への国際教育協力が必須であり、教員養成大学が担う一つの役割である。宮城教育大学・環境教育実践研究センタ－が取り組んできた環境教育の基盤に立ち、さらにJICAの協力支援の下、海外青年協力隊員の経験や実践活動の協力を得て新たな国際化ないしユニバ－サルな環境教育の教材開発について取り組んでいる。

research_project_title.ja: 幼児の食生活に関する研究

description.ja: 日中韓の幼稚園児を対象とし、陰膳実測法による食事調査によって栄養素および有害環境化学物質の摂取量調査と毛髪、爪による生体負荷量のモニタリング法について検証する

research_project_title.ja: 青少年の食と生活に関する研究

description.ja: 食教育および食生活習慣の形成における学校給食の役割を重視し、教員養成におけるカリキュラム上の位置づけや学校給食の実態および改善に関する課題について調査・研究する。

research_project_title.ja: 日本およびアジア人の微量元素レベルに関する栄養学的および環境中毒学的研究

description.ja: 地域住民を対象に陰膳実測法による食事調査と血液検査を主とする健康調査を1970年代後半から日本およびアジア地域で継続的に実施し、時間縦断的、地域横断的にその実態と特異性について調査している
